required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 4 Week Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacodynamics of ShK-186 (Dalazatide) in Active Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A 4 Week Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacodynamics of ShK-186 in Active Plaque Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to examine safety outcomes in active plaque psoriasis patients after systemic administration of dalazatide. Clinical outcome measures will also be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to examine safety outcomes in active plaque psoriasis patients after systemic administration of dalazatide. Clinical outcome measures will also be assessed.

secondary_outcome.description: Target lesion evaluated for erythema, induration, and scaling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient and Investigator Global Assessment of Psoriasis

secondary_outcome.description: Skin biopsy from psoriatic lesion collected for analysis of gene expression via qPCR and immune cell infiltration via histology and immunohistochemistry analysis.
Blood collected for analysis of gene and protein expression as well as immunophenotyping of T cell subsets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of specific anti-drug antibodies to dalazatide
secondary_outcome.description: Serum evaluated for specific anti-drug antibody using ELISA-based immunoassay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects with changes in vital signs
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs include temperature, respiratory rate, supine blood pressure and pulse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects with changes in symptom-directed physical examinations

other_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve of dalazatide (AUC)
other_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes pose dose, 15 minutes post dose, 30 minutes post dose, 1 hour post dose, 2 hours post dose, 4 hours post dose

arm_group.description: 12 subjects, 10 given active agent and 2 given placebo by subcutaneous injection twice weekly for 4 weeks.
12 subjects, 10 given active agent and 2 given placebo by subcutaneous injection twice weekly for 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection twice per week for a total of 9 doses, followed by four weeks of follow-up.
placebo, Subcutaneous injection twice per week for a total of 9 doses
